reviewText: The first "Bubblegum Crisis" series was one of the first Anime series that I saw. It was, and is, a great series that I would highly recommend to any Anime fan. This updated version of Bubblegum Crisis is pretty good, but I did'nt like the style of animation as much as the first series and it seems to be missing something. There is no "oomph!" that was evident in the first series; energy, engaging plot. And what is with the "morphing battle suits"? I did like this volume more than the others, however, and the series ended on a high note.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The third DVD of the original Bubblegum Crisis series contains my favorite episodes of the series.  Episode 7 of the series introduces an American idol singer, Vision, who suddenly comes out of obscurity to start a new concert tour, beginning in Tokyo, although she really has revenge on her mind.  The final episode of the original BGC series finds a snoopy reporter working with one of the Knight Sabers to uncover the identities of the fabled all-female fighting force even as Genom launches a new line of Boomers specifically to defeat the Knight Sabers.  Finally, the disc ends with four BGC music videos featuring the music of the series' own music group Priss and the Replicants set against excellent footage of the Bubblegum Crisis series.The series, inspired by Blade Runner and itself a tremendous influence on following anime, is full of fast-pacedaction and incredible music. This DVD provides anime newcomers with an excellent introduction to the world ofanime.
summary: The Best Episodes of the Bubblegum Crisis Series :-)
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have not really seen much of the original series that Tokyo 2040 is based on, but nevertheless, I truly enjoyed File 1: Shadow Warrior.  Not providing much spoilers, we begin the series by finding out that Lina, a mousy country girl, has just moved into town... and is looking for somebody.She's not just looking for anybody, she's looking for Tokyo's best vigilantes, the Knight Sabers: a group of beautiful women in armored suits that battle rogue menial-labor robots, or bloomers.  And she wants to join them because she's been following their rumors of their exsistance for the past year on the Internet.Since the Sabers are in need of more help, they decide to give her a try.  This is when things really start to heat up, especially when Lina tries on her own suit.  Watch out Lina, it's cold in that thing!  :DToo bad that things are picking up, you know.  Why?  It's the end of the first tape!!  oh jeez, I didn't get the second tape!! OH, what a cliffhanger at the end there!Take my wise advice, if you like to watch a good, well-written and well-drawn anime, then buy Bubblegum Crisis Tokyo 2040.  While you're at it, get the second volume too.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Does the animation look familiar? It should. It's from the same people who animated Tenchi in Tokyo. The story begins as a completely different story. Lina is a new comer to Tokyo (not a Knight Saber yet), Nene has yellow hair now (Knight Saber), Priss is more downbeat (Knight Saber) and Silia hasn't really changed that much (not a Knight Saber yet). LIna however is very determined to become a Knight Saber. Later on, she gets into a run in with Priss. Lina goes on a date with a guy from work who almost seduces her until a rogue boomer gone mad shows up. Lina ofcorse gets picked as the first victim. But then Priss and Nene come to save the day in their hard suits. In the next episode, Lina trys to track down Priss to find out more and gets a little trial run of a mission. And finally in the last episode, Lina takes out her new suit for a test run. The show doesnt really move that fast, but it is fun to watch. The music is heavy-metal rock unlike that 80's style rock in the OVA. The opening theme is extremely cool. The dubbing....well, I like the dubbing on Priss, Silia and Nene (no one can do a better cute voice then Hilary Haag), but Lina's dub voice is very winey and abnoxious. But then again, so was the Japanese voice. I found the show very enteraining and never gets boring. Get this and be amazed.
summary: A new move at an old classic
Title: N/A

reviewText: Lots of people bash this anime because it isn't as good as the original, they shoud've continued the original, blah, blah, blah.  Now, I have seen the original and I have to say that this series is far from it, but the series is good, none the less.First, the new characterizations (long  word).  It took a while to get used to them, but you do get used to them.  Except I don't really like the new character likeness of Silia.  She should  be the calm and cool one.The first video mainly introduces the  characters, but don't give up on buying the second video.  It is way better  than the first and believe me, things get intense.  And I mean  intense.Overall, the video is okay.  You can't miss Bubblegum Crisis.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This Video is the setup for a impressive storyarc.In this one, Priss is in her new "Hardsuit", and rescues the rest of the Knight Sabers from the Dragon Line.In the victory afterwards, Galatia continues to consume Tokyo. The Knight Sabers escape as their HQ is destroyed by a Boomer invasion, coupled with the Dragon Line blasting from underneath. They then run into a few survivors that mistake them for Boomers (or was it Voomers)?As they settle into and try to comfort each other on how to get out of the abandoned city, Nene discovers something very weird about Mackie...And, the relationship between Priss and Leon heat up....This only gives more fuel to the BGC 2040 storyline, and I recommend this one, but see the whole series!
summary: The BGC 2040 Saga steps into high gear.....
